2025-12-31.event_name: Expiration of Enhanced ACA Premium Tax Credits
2025-12-31.description: The enhanced premium tax credits under the American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) and extended under the Inflation Reduction Act are set to expire on December 31, 2025 unless Congress acts. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
2025-12-31.what_it_means: If expired, many households will face higher health insurance premiums, reducing disposable income and potentially dampening consumer spending; healthcare/insurer stocks may face margin pressure; broader risk sentiment could shift if large‑scale coverage losses or cost rises occur.

2026-01-30.event_name: Federal Government Funding Deadline (Continuing Resolution expires)
2026-01-30.description: A continuing resolution funds much of the federal government at FY2025 levels until January 30, 2026. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
2026-01-30.what_it_means: If Congress fails to pass full appropriations by then, risk of shutdown/stopgap funding returns, which could impair federal programmes, delay economic data, depress sentiment, and affect sectors reliant on federal contracts (defence, aerospace, regulatory).

2026-04-15.event_name: Individual Income Tax Return Deadline for 2025 Tax Year
2026-04-15.description: Deadline for individuals to file their 2025 federal tax returns (Form 1040) and pay any tax due (absent extension). :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
2026-04-15.what_it_means: Large flows of tax refunds or payments can influence household liquidity; higher than expected tax burdens may reduce consumer spending; companies in tax‑sensitive sectors might face earnings surprises if consumer behaviour shifts.

2026-11-03.event_name: U.S. General Midterm Elections (Congress, State & Local)
2026-11-03.description: The major U.S. mid‑term election day for federal offices (House and Senate) and many state/local seats. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
2026-11-03.what_it_means: Elections increase policy/regulatory uncertainty; markets may price in potential shifts in fiscal, regulatory or tax policy depending on likely party control; sectors such as healthcare, energy, financials may see heightened sensitivity.

2026‑(various dates).event_name: State and Federal Primaries and Candidate Announcements Leading up to 2026 Elections
2026‑(various dates).description: Throughout 2026 (and late 2025 into early 2026), many states hold primaries, candidate announcements and policy positioning ahead of the November general elections. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
2026‑(various dates).what_it_means: Even before the general election, markets may react to signals about which party or candidates may dominate, as this impacts expectations of policy — hence increased volatility, risk‑premium adjustments, especially in regulation‑sensitive sectors.
